data.title: Cahiers Du Cinéma The 1950s. 33 Alexandre Astruc
data.meta_description: Cahiers du Cinéma The 1950s. 33 Alexandre Astruc - Free download as PDF File (.pdf), Text File (.txt) or read online for free. Mise en scene is not about camera positioning or shot continuity, but about presenting characters and observing how they act and what motivates them. The director intervenes by running a course between the image through which they observe the world and the duration in which the resolution comes. One of the most beautiful films, Ugetsu Monogatari by Japanese director Mizoguchi, demonstrates mise en scene through extending states of mind into body movements without lying. Technique is used not to make what is ugly beautiful, but to generate distance between director and characters and accompany their movements with the camera. Mizoguchi draws back from his elements to a need to confirm something he has always known, bending events not to his
